Model types and capabilities

Different models are good at different work. Choose based on the task, the data you have, and the failure costs.

Choose a model family

Classical ML

Good at

  • Tabular prediction with clear features.
  • Fast training and simpler debugging.
  • Often easier to explain and measure.

Weak at

  • Needs good feature design.
  • Can struggle with unstructured data.
  • Still fails under distribution shift.

Typical real-world uses

Fraud scoringChurn predictionRisk rankingAnomaly scoring

Decision rule

Start with the simplest model that meets the need. Add complexity only when evaluation shows a real improvement and you can operate it safely.
